title: Getting Newer Tractors Out Into the Fields: Kennedy Implement 2012 Dealership of the Year 1

tasks.task: Describing a company's growth and market focus.
subtasks: Mentioning the company's history and market longevity.
Highlighting the company's principles and customer service.
Discussing the tractor classes they specialize in (100-150 horsepower).
Highlighting the high percentage (90%) of tractors sold in that power range.
Describing customer service practices (demonstrations, renting/loaning tractors).
Sharing customer testimonials and their decision to purchase.
Discussing the changing needs due to tough winters and better equipment performance.
Mentioning the potential market for combines and four-wheel drives.
Addressing the evolution in machine usage hours over 20 years.
Discussing the potential longevity of smaller tractors (20 years).
Exploring strategies to increase customer loyalty and technology adoption.
Discussing regional differences in tractor trading practices (10-15 years vs. every 5 years).
Highlighting the importance of keeping customers updated on technology advancements.
